RefParameter.Name: Resolution

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: In case of usage of channels on injected group, ADC frequency should be low than AHB clock frequency /4 for resolution 16, 14, 12 or 10 bits
In case of usage of channels on injected group, ADC frequency should be low than AHB clock frequency /4 for resolution 16, 14, 12 or 10 bits
In case of usage of channels on injected group, ADC frequency should be low than AHB clock frequency /3 for resolution 8 bits.
In case of usage of channels on injected group, ADC frequency should be low than AHB clock frequency /3 for resolution 6 bits.

RefParameter.Description: Resolution of the ADC conversion

RefParameter.Name: DataAlign
RefParameter.Description: Select the alignment of the data stored after conversion.

RefParameter.Description: Enable or Disable the Scan Conversion Mode

RefParameter.Name: ScanConvMode
RefParameter.Description: Enable or Disable the Scan Conversion Mode

RefParameter.Name: ContinuousConvMode

Condition.Diagnostic: The slave must have the same value of the master

RefParameter.Description: Enable or Disable the Continuous Conversion Mode

RefParameter.Name: ContinuousConvMode

Condition.Diagnostic: The slave must have the same value of the master

RefParameter.Description: Enable or Disable the Continuous Conversion Mode

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Continuous and Discontinuous modes could not be used at the same time

RefParameter.Name: DiscontinuousConvMode

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Continuous and Discontinuous modes could not be used at the same time

RefParameter.Description: Enable or Disable the Discontinuous Conversion Mode

RefParameter.Name: DMAContinuousRequests
RefParameter.Description: Enable/Disable DMA Continuous Requests

RefParameter.Name: EOCSelection
RefParameter.Description: Regular channel end of conversion selection

RefParameter.Name: Overrun
RefParameter.Description: Select the behaviour in case of overrun

RefParameter.Name: LowPowerAutoWait
RefParameter.Description: Specifies the usage of Low Power Auto Wait Mode: new conversion start only when the previous conversion (for regular group) or previous sequence (for injected group) has been treated by user software.

RefParameter.Name: EnableRegularConversion
RefParameter.Description: Enable/Disable Regular Conversion

RefParameter.Name: OversamplingMode
RefParameter.Description: Enable/Disable Regular Oversampling

RefParameter.Name: Ratio

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: shift for oversampling should be equal or greater than 1
Shift for oversampling should be equal or greater than 2
Shift for oversampling should be equal or greater than 3
Shift for oversampling should be equal or greater than 4

RefParameter.Description: Configure the Oversampling ratio

RefParameter.Name: OffsetSaturation
RefParameter.Description: Enable/Disable offset saturation

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Oversampling Continued Mode available only when Injected Oversampling Disabled

PossibleValue.Comment: Single trigger for all oversampled conversions

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Multi-Trigger Oversampled conversion available Only When: Oversampling Resumed Mode Selected And Injected Oversampling Disabled

RefParameter.Name: NbrOfConversion
RefParameter.Description: Number of regular channels to be converted

RefParameter.Name: NbrOfConversion
RefParameter.Description: Number of regular channels to be converted

Condition.Diagnostic: EXTI Line11 is used for External-Trigger-for-Regular-conversion mode.

RefParameter.Name: ExternalTrigConv
RefParameter.Description: Select the external event used to trigger the start of conversion of a regular group

RefParameter.Name: ExternalTrigConvEdge
RefParameter.Description: Select the external trigger polarity and enable the trigger of a regular group: When an external trigger is selected for ADC regular or injected conversion, only the rising edge of the signal can start the conversion.

RefParameter.Name: ExternalTrigConvEdge

PossibleValue.Comment: Trigger detection on the rising edge
Trigger detection on the falling edge
Trigger detection on the rising and falling edges

RefParameter.Description: Select the external trigger polarity and enable the trigger of a regular group: When an external trigger is selected for ADC regular or injected conversion, only the rising edge of the signal can start the conversion.

RefParameter.Name: SingleDiff
RefParameter.Description: Selection of single-ended or differential input

RefParameter.Description: The rank in the regular group sequencer

PossibleValue.Diagnostic: Analog Watchdog 2 is not selected
Analog Watchdog 3 is not selected
Analog Watchdog 2 and 3 are not selected

RefParameter.Description: For a dedicated channel, the generated analog watchdog configuration will correspond to the sum of all "Monitored" configurations for this channel when the number of ranks is greater than 1.

RefParameter.Description: Select a watchdog to monitor the channel.

RefParameter.Name: MonitoredBy
RefParameter.Description: Select a watchdog to monitor the channel.

RefParameter.Name: ExternalTrigInjecConvEdge
RefParameter.Description: You cannot configure a trigger because the Auto Injected mode is selected.

RefParameter.Name: ExternalTrigInjecConvEdge

PossibleValue.Comment: Trigger detection on the rising edge
Trigger detection on the falling edge
Trigger detection on the rising and falling edges

RefParameter.Description: Select the external trigger polarity and enable the trigger of a regular group: When an external trigger is selected for ADC regular or injected conversion, only the rising edge of the signal can start the conversion.

RefParameter.Name: injectedQueueMode

Condition.Diagnostic: In case of usage of channels on injected group, ADC frequency should be low than AHB clock frequency /4 for resolution 12 or 10 bits, AHB clock frequency /3 for resolution 8 bits, AHB clock frequency /2 for resolution 6 bits.

RefParameter.Description: Enable/Disable Injected Queue

Injected Queue Should be anabled to configure Mode

PossibleValue.Comment: Injected Queue context should be disabled while the queue mode disabled

RefParameter.Name: QueueInjectedContext

PossibleValue.Comment: Injected Queue enabled with Mode 0 (2 contexts, last active)
Injected Queue enabled with Mode 1 (2 contexts, queue end empty)

RefParameter.Description: Enable/Disable the queue of injected context
